comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Karl Franz Joseph Ludwig Hubert Georg Otto Marie von Habsburg-Lothringen, AKA Charles I of Austria. (1887-1922) From Wikipedia: "Charles became heir-presumptive with the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand, his uncle, in Sarajevo in 1914, the event which precipitated World War I. Charles succeeded to the thrones in November 1916, when his grand-uncle, Franz Josef I of Austria died. Charles also became a Generalfeldmarschall in the Austro-Hungarian Army." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_I_of_Austria Also, see Flickr Commons Project notes under: and Przemyśl was a huge fortress complex, one of the largest in Europe, located then in Austro-Hungary's Galicia, now in southeastern Poland. In a series of huge battles there in the first year of the war, 115,000 died, wounded or were missing in action. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Przemy%C5%9Bl#Przemy.C5.9Bl_Fortress
